Title:
Erysiphe paracarpinicola: a new species of Erysiphe sect.
Uncinula on Carpinus cordata (Betulaceae)
Keywords:
Erysiphaceae · Erysiphales · Erysiphe carpinicola ·
Molecular phylogeny · Taxonomy
Abstract:
A phylogeny of Erysiphe sect. Uncinula on Carpinus spp.
was reconstructed using the 28S rDNA sequences and a combined alignment
of the 28S, ITS, and IGS ribosomal DNA sequences. The analysis was
supplemented with morphological data obtained from examination of
voucher specimens. A sequence of E. sect. Uncinula on Carpinus cordata
formed a distinct lineage separated from sequences of other Erysiphe
species on Carpinus spp., indicating a cryptic species, which is
described as Erysiphe paracarpinicola. The new species is genetically as
well as morphologically most similar to E. carpinicola s. str., but
differs in having fewer asci per chasmothecium (mainly 35) and shorter
chasmothecial appendages. A key to species of Erysiphe sect. Uncinula on
Carpinus spp. is provided.
